info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued August 18 at 3:04PM PDT by NWS Reno
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of northwestern Churchill, Washoe, southwestern Pershing and northern Lyon Counties through 345 PM PDT... At 303 PM PDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm 12 miles north of Hazen, or 20 miles north of Lahontan Reservoir, moving east at 35 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 50 mph and pea size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Trinity Junction, Fernley Sink Near I-80, Battleground Point, Desert Peak and Junction I 80 And U.S 95 (exit 83). MAX HAIL SIZE...0.25 IN MAX WIND GUST...50 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building.
